title: Entrance to the Red Fort, Delhi
caption: Entrance to the Red Fort, Delhi
desc: It was on this day in 1931, that the city of Delhi was officially inaugurated as the capital of British territories in India, while the name ‘New Delhi’ was first used in 1927. Two decades earlier, in 1911, the British had made the decision to transfer the capital from Kolkata (then called Calcutta) to Delhi. New Delhi remained the capital of India after independence, and the partition of the country in 1947.
copyright: Lahori Gate of the Red Fort, Delhi (© powerofforever/iStock/Getty Images Plus)
